alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wayne and McCreary Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marshes Siding, or over Whitley City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Whitley City and Wiborg around 400 PM EDT. Pine Knot and Parkers Lake around 405 PM EDT. Beulah Heights around 410 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Honeybee, Hollyhill and Cumberland Falls S.P.. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
